docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This is a sample documentation site with various types of content. Here you'll find examples of different markdown elements and formatting options.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Basic understanding of Markdown
  • A text editor or IDE
  • Git (optional)

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
Our documentation includes the following features:

  1. Responsive Design - Works on all devices
  2. Code Highlighting - Syntax highlighting for multiple languages
  3. Search Functionality - Find content quickly
  4. Navigation - Easy-to-use sidebar navigation

docs.title: Key Benefits
docs.text: Feature Description Status Fast Loading Optimized for speed ✅ Complete Mobile Friendly Responsive design ✅ Complete Dark Mode Toggle theme support 🚧 In Progress Offline Support PWA capabilities 📝 Planned

docs.title: Code Examples
docs.text: Here are some code snippets in different languages:

docs.title: JavaScript
docs.text:
function greetUser(name) {
    return `Hello, ${name}! Welcome to our documentation.`;
}

const user = "Developer";
console.log(greetUser(user));

docs.title: Python
docs.text:
def calculate_fibonacci(n):
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    return calculate_fibonacci(n-1) + calculate_fibonacci(n-2)

# Generate first 10 Fibonacci numbers
for i in range(10):
    print(f"F({i}) = {calculate_fibonacci(i)}")

docs.title: CSS
docs.text:
.documentation-theme {
    --primary-color: #2563eb;
    --secondary-color: #64748b;
    --background-color: #f8fafc;
    --text-color: #334155;
}

.card {
    background: var(--background-color);
    border-radius: 8px;
    padding: 1.5rem;
    box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

docs.text:
• Browser: Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Safari 14+
  • Node.js: 16.x or higher (for development)
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM minimum
  • Storage: 100 MB available space

docs.title: 🌐 Overview
docs.text: Microsoft Azure is a comprehensive cloud computing platform that provides a wide range of services including computing, analytics, storage, and networking. Users can pick and choose from these services to develop and scale new applications or run existing applications in the public cloud.

docs.title: 📋 Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Core Services
  • Compute Services
  • Storage Solutions
  • Networking
  • AI & Machine Learning
  • Database Services
  • Security & Identity
  • DevOps & Development
  • Getting Started
  • Pricing Models

docs.title: Azure Resource Manager (ARM)
docs.text: Azure Resource Manager is the deployment and management service for Azure. It provides a management layer that enables you to create, update, and delete resources in your Azure account.

docs.title: Azure Portal
docs.text: The Azure portal is a web-based, unified console that provides an alternative to command-line tools. With the Azure portal, you can manage your Azure subscription using a graphical user interface.

docs.title: Virtual Machines
docs.text:
Azure Virtual Machines (VMs) give you the flexibility of virtualization without having to buy and maintain the physical hardware.

VM Series Use Case CPU Type A-Series Entry-level Basic D-Series General purpose Standard F-Series Compute optimized High-performance G-Series Memory optimized Large memory

docs.title: Azure App Service
docs.text:
A fully managed platform for building, deploying, and scaling web apps.

# Create a resource group
az group create --name myResourceGroup --location "East US"

# Create an App Service plan
az appservice plan create --name myAppServicePlan --resource-group myResourceGroup --sku B1

# Create a web app
az webapp create --resource-group myResourceGroup --plan myAppServicePlan --name myUniqueAppName

docs.title: Azure Functions
docs.text:
Event-driven, serverless compute platform that can solve complex orchestration problems.

// Sample Azure Function (HTTP Trigger)
module.exports = async function (context, req) {
    context.log('JavaScript HTTP trigger function processed a request.');

    const name = (req.query.name || (req.body && req.body.name));
    const responseMessage = name
        ? "Hello, " + name + ". This HTTP triggered function executed successfully."
        : "This HTTP triggered function executed successfully. Pass a name in the query string or in the request body for a personalized response.";

    context.res = {
        status: 200,
        body: responseMessage
    };
}

docs.title: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
docs.text: Managed Kubernetes service that simplifies deploying a managed Kubernetes cluster in Azure.

docs.title: Blob Storage
docs.text:
Azure Blob storage is optimized for storing massive amounts of unstructured data.

from azure.storage.blob import BlobServiceClient
import os

# Initialize the BlobServiceClient
blob_service_client = BlobServiceClient(
    account_url="https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net",
    credential="your_account_key"
)

# Upload a file
def upload_blob(file_path, container_name, blob_name):
    blob_client = blob_service_client.get_blob_client(
        container=container_name, 
        blob=blob_name
    )

    with open(file_path, "rb") as data:
        blob_client.upload_blob(data, overwrite=True)

    print(f"Uploaded {blob_name} to {container_name}")

docs.title: File Storage
docs.text: Fully managed file shares in the cloud accessible via SMB protocol.

docs.title: Table Storage
docs.text: NoSQL key-attribute data store using a schemaless design.

docs.title: Virtual Network (VNet)
docs.text: Azure Virtual Network enables Azure resources to securely communicate with each other, the internet, and on-premises networks.

docs.title: Load Balancer
docs.text: Distribute incoming network traffic across multiple virtual machines.

docs.title: Application Gateway
docs.text: Web traffic load balancer with additional capabilities like SSL termination and Web Application Firewall.

docs.title: Azure Cognitive Services
docs.text:
Pre-built AI models that you can integrate into your applications.

using Microsoft.Azure.CognitiveServices.Vision.ComputerVision;
using Microsoft.Azure.CognitiveServices.Vision.ComputerVision.Models;

public class ComputerVisionService
{
    private readonly ComputerVisionClient client;

    public ComputerVisionService(string endpoint, string subscriptionKey)
    {
        client = new ComputerVisionClient(new ApiKeyServiceClientCredentials(subscriptionKey))
        {
            Endpoint = endpoint
        };
    }

    public async Task<string> AnalyzeImageAsync(string imageUrl)
    {
        var features = new List<VisualFeatureTypes?>
        {
            VisualFeatureTypes.Description,
            VisualFeatureTypes.Objects,
            VisualFeatureTypes.Tags
        };

        var analysis = await client.AnalyzeImageAsync(imageUrl, features);
        return analysis.Description.Captions.FirstOrDefault()?.Text ?? "No description available";
    }
}

docs.title: Azure Machine Learning
docs.text: End-to-end machine learning lifecycle management.

docs.title: Azure OpenAI Service
docs.text: Access to OpenAI's powerful language models including GPT-4, GPT-3.5-turbo, and DALL-E.

docs.title: Azure SQL Database
docs.text: Fully managed relational database with auto-scale, integral intelligence, and robust security.

docs.title: Cosmos DB
docs.text:
Globally distributed, multi-model database service.

-- Sample Azure SQL Database query
SELECT 
    p.ProductName,
    p.Price,
    c.CategoryName
FROM Products p
INNER JOIN Categories c ON p.CategoryID = c.CategoryID
WHERE p.Price > 100
ORDER BY p.Price DESC;

docs.title: Azure Database for MySQL/PostgreSQL
docs.text: Fully managed database services for open-source databases.

docs.title: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)
docs.text: Microsoft's cloud-based identity and access management service.

docs.title: Key Vault
docs.text: Safeguard cryptographic keys and secrets used by cloud applications and services.

docs.title: Security Center
docs.text: Unified security management and advanced threat protection across hybrid cloud workloads.

docs.title: Azure DevOps
docs.text:
Set of development tools for software teams including Azure Boards, Azure Repos, Azure Pipelines, Azure Test Plans, and Azure Artifacts.

# Azure Pipelines YAML example
trigger:
- main

pool:
  vmImage: 'ubuntu-latest'

variables:
  buildConfiguration: 'Release'

steps:
- task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
  displayName: 'Restore packages'
  inputs:
    command: 'restore'
    projects: '**/*.csproj'

- task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
  displayName: 'Build project'
  inputs:
    command: 'build'
    projects: '**/*.csproj'
    arguments: '--configuration $(buildConfiguration)'

- task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
  displayName: 'Run tests'
  inputs:
    command: 'test'
    projects: '**/*Tests.csproj'
    arguments: '--configuration $(buildConfiguration) --collect "Code coverage"'

docs.title: GitHub Actions for Azure
docs.text: Automate your software development workflows right in your GitHub repository.

docs.title: Step 1: Create an Azure Account
docs.text:
1. Visit azure.microsoft.com
  2. Click "Start free" or "Free account"
  3. Sign up with your Microsoft account or create a new one
  4. Verify your identity and add payment information (free tier available)

docs.title: Step 2: Install Azure CLI
docs.text:
# Install Azure CLI on Windows
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://aka.ms/installazurecliwindows -OutFile .\AzureCLI.msi
Start-Process msiexec.exe -Wait -ArgumentList '/I AzureCLI.msi /quiet'

# Login to Azure
az login

# Set your subscription
az account set --subscription "your-subscription-id"

docs.title: Step 3: Create Your First Resource
docs.text:
# Create a resource group
az group create --name "my-first-rg" --location "eastus"

# Create a storage account
az storage account create \
    --name mystorageaccount123 \
    --resource-group my-first-rg \
    --location eastus \
    --sku Standard_LRS

docs.title: Pay-As-You-Go
docs.text: Pay only for what you use with no upfront costs.

docs.title: Reserved Instances
docs.text: Save up to 72% compared to pay-as-you-go pricing with 1-year or 3-year terms.

docs.title: Azure Hybrid Benefit
docs.text: Use your existing on-premises Windows Server and SQL Server licenses on Azure.

docs.title: Free Tier Services
docs.text:
Azure offers several services with free tiers:

Service Free Tier Limits App Service 10 web apps Functions 1 million executions/month Cosmos DB 5 GB storage Blob Storage 5 GB LRS hot storage Virtual Machines 750 hours B1S instance

docs.title: Security
docs.text:
• Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
  • Use Azure Key Vault for secrets management
  • Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
  • Enable Azure Security Center recommendations

docs.title: Cost Optimization
docs.text:
• Use Azure Cost Management + Billing
  • Implement resource tagging strategy
  • Set up budget alerts
  • Consider reserved instances for predictable workloads

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
• Choose the right Azure region
  • Use Azure CDN for global content delivery
  • Implement auto-scaling
  • Monitor with Azure Monitor and Application Insights

docs.title: Reliability
docs.text:
• Design for failure with redundancy
  • Use availability zones
  • Implement backup and disaster recovery
  • Use health checks and monitoring

docs.title: 📞 Support & Contact
docs.text:
